fields.description:
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HiveServer2+Clients#HiveServer2Clients-ConnectionURLs
documents that sessions variables like credentials etc are accepted as part of the URL. However, Beeline does not support such URLs today.
fields.summary: Beeline doesnt support session parameters in JDBC URL as documentation states.

comments.body:
With the attached patch beeline will now honor URL such as 
beeline> !connect "jdbc:hive2://localhost:10000/default/;user=hive;password=hive"
or
$ beeline -u "jdbc:hive2://localhost:10000/default/;user=hive;password=hive"
which is equivalent to  
$ beeline -u "jdbc:hive2://localhost:10000/default/" -n hive -p hive

Currently, beeline prompts for credentials even when principal (kerberized credentials) is specified in the URL.This fix should resolve this issue too. It will no longer prompt for credentials when principal is specified in the URL.
For some reason, the ptest never picked up the patch. Hoping a re-submit will work.

Code posted to review board at 
https://reviews.apache.org/r/46656/
Same patch as the first version, created without --no-prefix to git diff
